<h3 id="X428">X(428)&nbsp;=&nbsp;EULER X(38)-5th-SUBSTITUTION POINT</h3>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; 3 sec A - csc A tan &omega; : :
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; csc A - 3 sec A cot &omega; : :
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; (a^2 + b^2 - c^2)*(a^2 - b^2 + c^2)*(2*a^2 + b^2 + c^2) : :
<b><br>
X(428) = 5 X[2] - 4 X[7734], 3 X[2] - 4 X[10128], 7 X[2] - 8 X[13361], 4 X[2] - 3 X[43957], 4 X[4] - X[1885], 2 X[4] + X[3575], 5 X[4] + X[6240], X[4] + 2 X[6756], 5 X[4] - 2 X[13488], 3 X[4] + X[18559], 7 X[4] - X[18560], 11 X[4] + X[34797], 2 X[5] + X[7553], X[20] - 4 X[9825], 4 X[140] - 3 X[43934], X[382] + 2 X[31833], 2 X[546] + X[11819], 4 X[546] - X[12605], X[548] - 4 X[13163], 5 X[1656] - 8 X[23411], X[1885] + 2 X[3575], 5 X[1885] + 4 X[6240], X[1885] + 8 X[6756], X[1885] + 4 X[7576], 5 X[1885] - 8 X[13488], 3 X[1885] + 4 X[18559], 7 X[1885] - 4 X[18560], 11 X[1885] + 4 X[34797], 5 X[3091] - 2 X[12362], X[3146] + 2 X[31829], 5 X[3575] - 2 X[6240], X[3575] - 4 X[6756], 5 X[3575] + 4 X[13488], 3 X[3575] - 2 X[18559], 7 X[3575] + 2 X[18560], 11 X[3575] - 2 X[34797], X[3627] + 2 X[31830], 7 X[3832] - X[12225], 3 X[3839] - X[52069], 5 X[3843] - X[18564], 5 X[3858] - 2 X[52073], 4 X[3861] - X[52070], X[6240] - 10 X[6756], X[6240] - 5 X[7576], X[6240] + 2 X[13488], 3 X[6240] - 5 X[18559], 7 X[6240] + 5 X[18560], 11 X[6240] - 5 X[34797], and many others
</b><p>
As a point on the Euler line, X(428) has Shinagawa coefficients (F,-3E - 3F).
</p><p>
Let V = P(4)-Ceva conjugate of U(4)) and W = U(4)-Ceva conjugate of P(4); then V and W lie on the orthocentroidal circle, and with with PU(4) they are the vertices of a cyclic trapezoid.  The midpoint of V and W is X(428).  (Randy Hutson, December 26, 2015)
</p><p>
Let H = X(4) and let A'B'C' be the pedal triangle of H in the plane of a triangle ABC.  Let<br>
Bc = reflection of B' in HC', and define Ca and Ab cyclically;<br>
Cb = reflection of C' in HB', and define Ac and Ba cyclically;<br>
Ha = orthogonal projecton of A on BcCb, and define Hb and Hc cyclically.<br>
Then X(428) = centroid of triangle HaHbHc.  See Antreas Hatzipolakis and Peter Moses, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=27169"> <b>Hyacinthos 27169</b></a>
</p><p>
X(428) lies on these lines: {1, 51719}, {2, 3}, {6, 31166}, {11, 5322}, {12, 5310}, {19, 5101}, {33, 3058}, {34, 5434}, {51, 1503}, {53, 2980}, {98, 39284}, {107, 29316}, {125, 44106}, {132, 137}, 52142}<br>
</p><p>
X(428) = midpoint of X(i) and X(j) for these {i,j}: {2, 34603}, {4, 7576}, {376, 34613}, {381, 7540}, {551, 34633}, {3058, 34666}, {3241, 34668}, {3543, 38323}, {3679, 34657}, {3830, 38321}, {4421, 34655}, {5186, 12132}, {5434, 34653}, {5890, 16658}, {7811, 34661}, {9909, 34659}, {11194, 34663}, {12150, 34651}, {15682, 44458}, {15687, 38322}, {38320, 50687}<br>
X(428) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these {i,j}: {1, 51719}, {3, 10127}, {6, 51745}, {549, 23410}, {3575, 7576}, {7576, 6756}, {7667, 2}, {10691, 10128}, {11245, 51}, {34614, 376}, {34634, 551}, {34650, 12150}, {34652, 5434}, {34654, 4421}, {34656, 3679}, {34658, 9909}, {34660, 7811}, {34662, 11194}, {34664, 381}, {34665, 3058}, {34667, 3241}, {52397, 10691}<br>
X(428) = isogonal conjugate of X(41435)<br>
X(428) = complement of X(52397)<br>
X(428) = anticomplement of X(10691)<br>
X(428) = circumcircle-inverse of X(37920)<br>
X(428) = orthocentroidal-circle-inverse of X(5064)<br>
X(428) = polar-circle-inverse of X(5189)<br>
X(428) = orthoptic-circle-of-the-Steiner-inellipse inverse of X(37943)<br>
X(428) = polar conjugate of X(10159)<br>
X(428) = isotomic conjugate of the isogonal conjugate of X(44091)<br>
X(428) = isogonal conjugate of the isotomic conjugate of X(44142)<br>
X(428) = polar conjugate of the isotomic conjugate of X(3589)<br>
X(428) = polar conjugate of the isogonal conjugate of X(5007)<br>
X(428) = orthic-isogonal conjugate of X(46026)<br>
X(428) = X(i)-Ceva conjugate of X(j) for these (i,j): {4, 46026}, {41676, 2489}, {42396, 2501}, {44142, 3589}<br>
X(428) = X(i)-cross conjugate of X(j) for these (i,j): {5007, 3589}, {46026, 44142}<br>
X(428) = X(i)-isoconjugate of X(j) for these (i,j): {1, 41435}, {48, 10159}, {63, 3108}, {656, 7953}, {810, 35137}, {4020, 40425}, {4575, 31065}, {31068, 36060}<br>
X(428) = X(i)-Dao conjugate of X(j) for these (i,j): {3, 41435}, {69, 6292}, {136, 31065}, {428, 52397}, {525, 15527}, {1249, 10159}, {1560, 31068}, {2525, 39691}, {3108, 3162}, {3589, 3933}, {4580, 51906}, {7953, 40596}, {35137, 39062}<br>
X(428) = cevapoint of X(5007) and X(44091)<br>
X(428) = crosspoint of X(4) and X(32085)<br>
X(428) = crosssum of X(3) and X(3917)<br>
X(428) = crossdifference of every pair of points on line {647, 22121}<br>
X(428) = X(2)-of-anti-Ara-triangle<br>
X(428) = X(354)-of-orthic-triangle if ABC is acute<br>
X(428) = X(2) of 3rd pedal triangle of X(4)<br>
X(428) = {X(2),X(4)}-harmonic conjugate of X(5064)
X(428) = barycentric product X(i)*X(j) for these {i,j}: {4, 3589}, {6, 44142}, {25, 39998}, {76, 44091}, {83, 46026}, {92, 17469}, {264, 5007}, {278, 4030}, {281, 7198}, {286, 21802}, {393, 7767}, {648, 7927}, {1783, 48152}, {1824, 16707}, {1826, 17200}, {1897, 48101}, {2052, 22352}, {2501, 10330}, {6292, 32085}, {6331, 8664}, {11205, 46104}, {28666, 52395}<br>
X(428) = barycentric quotient X(i)/X(j) for these {i,j}: {4, 10159}, {6, 41435}, {25, 3108}, {112, 7953}, {468, 31068}, {648, 35137}, {2501, 31065}, {3589, 69}, {4030, 345}, {5007, 3}, {6292, 3933}, {7198, 348}, {7767, 3926}, {7927, 525}, {8664, 647}, {10330, 4563}, {11205, 3917}, {17200, 17206}, {17469, 63}, {21802, 72}, {22352, 394}, {28666, 7794}, {32085, 40425}, {39998, 305}, {44091, 6}, {44142, 76}, {46026, 141}, {48101, 4025}, {48152, 15413}<br>
